instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0.8V
threads.message:
Board had very little corrosion on <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>, replaced it and now <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> is only 0.8V

Resistance on pins 17-18 and 27-28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> is correct
ppbus is 12.6V

<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:1 12.6V
<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:12 3.4V
<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:4 3.4V
<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:21 3.4V

Already check for shorts and all is ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0.8V
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:4 3.4V"
Are you sure about this?
Is really strange, if <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> is not present; means no <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> also.

Post again basic <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> voltages; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21, 4.
Do you get (or not) L7260 voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0.8V
threads.message:
Thanks, I measured wrong,  <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:4 is 0.8V

<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:4 0.8V
<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:12 3.4V
<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:13 1.3V
<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:21 3.4V
<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:22 5.8V
<CHIP>U7201</CHIP>:29 0.8V

No voltage on L7260

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0.8V
threads.message:
5.8V at VREG3???
Please post accurate information.

Where is pin 23 voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0.8V
threads.message:
5.8V at VREG3 yes that is correct!!

I just updated my last answer to include pin 23 voltage 12.6V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0.8V
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0.8V
threads.message: As stated in the description, <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> was already replaced, but just in case I just replaced it again, but same measurements.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0.8V
threads.message: Check all surrounding caps and resistors.
